eg.javatools

Class JarBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • eg.javatools.JarBuilder

  • public class JarBuilder
extends java.lang.Object
    The creation of a jar file of a project.

    The jar is saved in the folder containing the class files (packages) which is the classpath.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      JarBuilder(ConsolePanel consPnl) 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void createJar(java.lang.String root, java.lang.String jarName, java.lang.String qualifiedMain, java.lang.String execDir, java.lang.String sourceDir, java.lang.String[] includedExt)
      Creates a jar file

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • JarBuilder

        public JarBuilder(ConsolePanel consPnl)
        Parameters:
        consPnl - the reference to ConsolePanel

    • Method Detail

      • createJar

        public void createJar(java.lang.String root,
                      java.lang.String jarName,
                      java.lang.String qualifiedMain,
                      java.lang.String execDir,
                      java.lang.String sourceDir,
                      java.lang.String[] includedExt)
               throws java.io.IOException
        Creates a jar file
        Parameters:
        root - the root directory of the project
        jarName - the name for the jar file
        qualifiedMain - the fully qualified name of the main class
        execDir - the name of the directory that contains class files. Can be the empty string but cannot be null.
        sourceDir - the name of the directory that contains source files. Can be the empty string but cannot be not null.
        includedExt - the array of extensions of files that are included in the jar file in addition to class files. May be null.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the process that creates a jar cannot receive any input
